2019-07-14T15:01:43Z: Thanks so much for joining us, see you back here - same time, same place - in two weeks for our coverage of the German Grand Prix and be sure to check out autosport.com for all the latest news and reaction in the meantime
2019-07-14T14:58:37Z: What a British Grand Prix that was! Catch up on anything you might have missed with our race report. Lewis Hamilton takes record-breaking sixth British Grand Prix winLewis Hamilton won the British Grand Prix after jumping Formula 1 title rival Valtteri Bottas with a safety car-assisted strategy, while Sebastian Vettel wiped Max Verstappen out of third
2019-07-14T14:50:06Z: Hamilton and Leclerc catch each other up on their respective races as they wait in the podium room, while aerial shots show the rush of fans for the podium
2019-07-14T14:40:54Z: Hamilton reaches parc ferme after his victory lap, hoisting the Union flag into the air and heading straight for his Mercedes team
2019-07-14T14:39:21Z: Hamilton collects a Union flag from a marshal and begins to wave it on his return to the pits.
2019-07-14T14:37:26Z: Norris also cleared Albon, as the medium tyres didn't last, as Stroll, Russell, Kubica, Vettel and Perez complete the field.
2019-07-14T14:36:40Z: Sainz just hangs on from Ricciardo at the end, as Raikkonen, Kvyat and Hulkenberg complete the scorers.
2019-07-14T14:35:58Z: Pierre Gasly comes home a strong fourth after an accomplished weekend, with Verstappen fifth after his hit from Vettel.
2019-07-14T14:35:19Z: Bottas comes home second, 25s down on his team-mate, as Charles Leclerc rounds out the podium.
2019-07-14T14:34:57Z: Lewis Hamilton wins the British Grand Prix for a sixth time, and sets fastest lap on the run to the chequered flag.
2019-07-14T14:34:17Z: Albon loses 10th to Hulkenberg at the death, as he just seems to have run out of tyres.
2019-07-14T14:33:46Z: Hamilton has started his final lap. Victory, with Bottas second, will put him 37 points clear of his Mercedes team-mate in the drivers' standings.
2019-07-14T14:33:01Z: Kvyat has closed to DRS range of Raikkonen with two laps left, as up the road Ricciardo is still after Sainz.
2019-07-14T14:32:58Z: The battle for the final podium position has fizzled out, too. Leclerc has 3.8s in hand over Gasly, who is 5s clear of Verstappen.
2019-07-14T14:31:51Z: Hamilton starts the penultimate lap 21.143s clear of Bottas.
2019-07-14T14:29:09Z: Ricciardo's not giving up here, he's got tremendous speed over Sainz in sector two but he can't find his way past.
2019-07-14T14:29:05Z: Bottas smashes the previous best fastest lap, setting a 1m27.406s.
2019-07-14T14:27:29Z: The Mercedes crew keeps heading out into the pitlane, but Hamilton stays out once again.
2019-07-14T14:26:34Z: Really good defending from Sainz, warding off an attempt from Ricciardo at Stowe to keep hold of sixth place.
2019-07-14T14:25:44Z: Kvyat has passed Albon for P9 - and the Thai driver might not actually need to stop again after all; Hulkenberg's far enough away to presumably lock down a double-points finish for Toro Rosso.
2019-07-14T14:25:41Z: Bottas rejoins with a couple of seconds in hand over Leclerc.
2019-07-14T14:24:46Z: Hamilton doesn't stop next time by either, but Bottas does! He switches onto what would appear to be a used set of softs.
2019-07-14T14:23:25Z: Hamilton was told to pit at the end of lap 44, but continued onto the start/finish straight.
2019-07-14T14:23:21Z: That's a slow Hulkenberg! Meanwhile, Raikkonen clears Albon for eighth.
2019-07-14T14:22:31Z: Verstappen doesn't seem to be making proper inroads into the cars ahead, so Red Bull's podium hopes would appear to rest with Gasly. He's 1.8s behind Leclerc right now.
2019-07-14T14:20:57Z: Believe it or not, there's only 10 laps to go. Sainz is under heavy fire from Ricciardo now, both looking to cement a valuable sixth place finish.
2019-07-14T14:20:56Z: Vettel has been awarded a 10-second time penalty for rear-ending Verstappen.
2019-07-14T14:19:10Z: Raikkonen's right on Albon's tail - the Toro Rosso driver still has to pit, which will elevate Kvyat into 10th when he does.
2019-07-14T14:18:34Z: Hamilton then goes fastest of all with a 1m28.568s on the next lap.
2019-07-14T14:18:11Z: Back at the front... Bottas sets a new fastest lap of the race - he and Hamilton are into the 1m28s - but he's still 2.2s behind his team-mate. Remember, he's still got another stop to make.
2019-07-14T14:16:52Z: Vettel's plummet down the field has elevated Sainz into sixth place, but Ricciardo's within a second of the McLaren.
2019-07-14T14:16:02Z: Vettel pits for a change of nose, but is last in the order now.
2019-07-14T14:15:43Z: The incident is, unsurprisingly, under investigation. That should take less time to come to a verdict on than the most recent Ferrari-Red Bull incident.
2019-07-14T14:14:52Z: That has however promoted Leclerc back to third and Gasly into fourth. Verstappen is 7s off that pair, while Vettel is trundling back to the pits.
2019-07-14T14:14:12Z: Verstappen had a massive run on the Ferrari into Stowe and got the place, then covered the inside line - only for the Ferrari to hit the Red Bull from behind. Both go through the gravel, before getting going again.
2019-07-14T14:12:59Z: Verstappen is through on Vettel... but no! Vettel hits the Red Bull on the approach to Club!
2019-07-14T14:11:20Z: Oh, lovely move from Leclerc. Just as it looked like Gasly was safe from attack, Leclerc chucks it round the outside at Village. The Ferrari heads onto the Wellington Straight ahead and, although Gasly gives it a good go trying to retaliate, Leclerc is through into fifth.
2019-07-14T14:10:25Z: Norris pits from eighth, which drops him just a second clear of Russell.
2019-07-14T14:09:07Z: Another new fastest lap of the race from Hamilton, who is two seconds clear of Bottas.
2019-07-14T14:07:30Z: Verstappen has chipped away at Vettel's advantage, and is now within a second of the Ferrari.
2019-07-14T14:07:15Z: We expect Norris and Albon to have to stop again too, which seems to drop them out of points contention at their home race.
2019-07-14T14:02:58Z: Ricciardo's all over Norris now, taking a look into Brooklands but has his effort rebuffed.
2019-07-14T14:02:14Z: Bottas fends off Hamilton in the opening laps. Those positions have since been reversed
2019-07-14T14:01:12Z: No let up from the Mercedes. Hamilton is 1.9s clear of Bottas now after setting a 1m29.190s.
2019-07-14T14:00:18Z: Three cars in the 1m29s at the moment - Hamilton sets a new fastest lap of 1m29.504s, Bottas is a tenth and a half slower, and Verstappen three tenths down.
2019-07-14T13:58:09Z: Hamilton takes back fastet lap from Bottas next time by and is 1.7s clear of his team-mate.
2019-07-14T13:57:45Z: Gasly appears to lift at the end of the Hangar Straight this time by, releasing Verstappen into fourth. What can he do about Vettel?
2019-07-14T13:57:18Z: Replay of that Perez incident; Hulkenberg rather drove across the path of the Mexican, and that broke the Racing Point front wing. Probably a 50/50 incident?
2019-07-14T13:57:13Z: Bottas sets the fastest lap so far - a 1m29.958s - as we enter the second half of the race, but the gap remains more than a second between Hamilton and himself.
2019-07-14T13:55:50Z: Hulkenberg's fallen a bit, and is now in the clutches of Stroll and Kvyat.
2019-07-14T13:54:52Z: Ricciardo clears Albon for 9th, but might've completed that off of the road at Brooklands.
2019-07-14T13:54:40Z: Hamilton's advantage over Bottas is up to 1.1s on lap 26.
2019-07-14T13:54:04Z: More great racing from Verstappen and Leclerc! The Ferrari driver goes around the outside at Vale, which gives him the inside line on the run onto the main straight, but Verstappen keeps his foot in around the outside and cuts back in front of Leclerc.
2019-07-14T13:52:54Z: Verstappen is tucked right up behind Gasly, and that nearly costs him a position to Leclerc.
2019-07-14T13:52:37Z: A messy midfield at the restart! Albon tries a move on Norris but can't clear the McLaren, as Perez collects a Renault at Brooklands and breaks his front wing!
2019-07-14T13:51:48Z: Hamilton backs the pack up at the end of the Hangar Straight, then bolts for it and quickly breaks clear of Bottas.
2019-07-14T13:50:44Z: The safety car will be in at the end of this lap.
2019-07-14T13:50:25Z: Order under the safety car: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Vettel; 4 Gasly; 5 Verstappen; 6 Leclerc; 7 Sainz; 8 Norris; 9 Albon; 10 Hulkenberg.
2019-07-14T13:49:55Z: The safety car period is coming to an end at the end of this lap.
2019-07-14T13:49:43Z: Leclerc is baffled about how he's lost position. Is it that much of a surprise, though?
2019-07-14T13:48:31Z: A lot of drivers opting to change their medium tyres to hards - Kvyat's also been in, as has Ricciardo. Anyone on mediums - including Bottas - is at a big disadvantage.
2019-07-14T13:47:59Z: Leclerc pits next time by and is now back in sixth.
2019-07-14T13:46:12Z: This has worked out nicely for Sainz, who's basically ended up with a free pitstop to emerge in P7, ahead of team-mate Norris.
2019-07-14T13:46:07Z: Vettel also pits - taking on hards, like Hamilton - and jumps Leclerc for third. Verstappen also takes a punt and heads in to switch to hards, rejoining in sixth.
2019-07-14T13:45:23Z: Hero to zero for Giovinazzi. After grabbing a point last time out in Austria, another spin means his day is done.
2019-07-14T13:44:55Z: Huge gain for Hamilton, who emerges in the lead!
2019-07-14T13:44:09Z: Hamilton takes advantage of that and pits.
2019-07-14T13:43:43Z: Giovinazzi's off! The Italian's beached his car in the gravel at Club, and that'll be a safety car!
2019-07-14T13:42:22Z: Perez and Raikkonen came in from eighth and ninth, rejoining either side of 14th-placed Russell.
2019-07-14T13:42:14Z: Wow! Verstappen gets a great run down to Stowe and has just enough room up the inside to slot his Red Bull into, but Leclerc brakes later and keeps the position around the outside.
2019-07-14T13:41:14Z: And that was quick, the Norris/Albon incident will require no further action.
2019-07-14T13:41:02Z: Leclerc's doing a really good job here. Verstappen clearly has the faster car right now, but the Ferrari driver is covering his every move into Brooklands.
2019-07-14T13:40:08Z: Norris and Albon are under investigation for a pitlane incident.
2019-07-14T13:39:59Z: Hamilton, in clear air, sets a 1m30.236s new fastest lap (and lap record). Game on in the fight for the lead!
2019-07-14T13:39:15Z: Bottas pits from the lead, and heads back out on more mediums.
2019-07-14T13:37:48Z: Verstappen gets close again through the quick opening turns, but can't get by. The Ferrari also seems to be getting a great exit onto the Wellington straight, which helps Leclerc stay ahead.
2019-07-14T13:36:50Z: Kvyat has managed to clear Stroll in the pits, and he's just 4.5s behind Hulkenberg - so the Russian's well in the battle for points after a poor qualifying session.
2019-07-14T13:35:31Z: Rare mistake from Verstappen. Leclerc gleefully snatches the position out of the corner and keeps hold of his net third on the Wellington straight.
2019-07-14T13:35:03Z: Ricciardo clear Norris in the pits, as Albon, Hulkenberg and Kvyat have also been in.
2019-07-14T13:34:37Z: Gasly is actually on the hardest compound of all.
2019-07-14T13:34:15Z: Leclerc and Verstappen are both in next time by. They emerge side-by-side, but the position is Verstappen's, until he runs wide exiting the loop!
2019-07-14T13:33:10Z: Gasly is the first to blink after that overtake and pits. He's back out on another set of mediums, so will definitely be two-stopping.
2019-07-14T13:32:05Z: That squabbling means Leclerc is now 7.6s behind race leader Bottas.
2019-07-14T13:31:29Z: That proved timely, as Gasly - who's comfortably putting on his best show to date - dives past Vettel to take fifth into the loop, then defends the position successfully on the run to Brooklands.
2019-07-14T13:30:38Z: Verstappens eagerness almost comes back to bite him! He gets close to Leclerc through the loop but is compromised on the exit, and that gives Vettel a sniff along the straight. All four holding station, for now at least.
2019-07-14T13:29:26Z: Verstappen half-thinks about making a move at Stowe at the end of lap 10 but backs out of it, then launches a bit of an attack into the Vale.
2019-07-14T13:28:45Z: Perez is making good progress, having cleared Raikkonen for 12th. 3.3 seconds behind Sainz, Perez has some clear air to carve into the gap. Stroll's also reeling Raikkonen in now - Alfa don't look so good in race trim.
2019-07-14T13:27:47Z: Hamilton is back within half a second of Bottas now. Verstappen is fairly close to Leclerc, too, in the battle for third.
2019-07-14T13:26:59Z: Norris can't quite seem to shake Ricciardo from DRS range, as Albon's just about keeping tabs on Hulkenberg. Sainz isn't too far off this quartet either.
2019-07-14T13:25:33Z: Current lead gaps, as Bottas sets a new fastest lap: 1 Bottas; 2 Hamilton +0.7s; 3 Leclerc +3.6s; 4 Verstappen +3.8s; 5 Vettel +5.5s; 6 Gasly +6.4s.
2019-07-14T13:25:07Z: Magnussen's in the pits again, and it looks like it might be day done for the Dane. Dis-haas-ter.
2019-07-14T13:23:59Z: Hamilton sets a 1m30.967s to steal fastest lap from Bottas, and is back within DRS range of his team-mate.
2019-07-14T13:23:28Z: Sorry, we defaulted to standard form with our declaration that there had been no position changes among the leaders on the opening lap. Vettel jumped Gasly and runs fifth.
2019-07-14T13:23:24Z: The battle for seventh has plenty of potential, with Norris, Ricciardo, Hulkenberg and Albon all within about 2 seconds.
2019-07-14T13:21:49Z: At the other end of the field, Giovinazzi has slipped all the way down to 16th after starting 11th, and is now within DRS reach of Russell.
2019-07-14T13:21:41Z: Bottas set the fastest lap while defending from Hamilton, and goes faster next time by too. He sets a 1m31.013s as his advantage balloons to one second.
2019-07-14T13:20:29Z: Breathtaking stuff! Hamilton gets a brilliant run on Bottas down to Brooklands and goes around the outside. That doesn't quite work, but Bottas squirms deep and Hamilton cuts back around the outside at Luffield. It looks like the position is his - but then Bottas comes back through at Copse! Great racing.
2019-07-14T13:18:26Z: Hamilton, DRS-assisted, has massive overspeed compared to Bottas down the Hangar Straight, but decides to just show to the outside of Bottas.
2019-07-14T13:17:18Z: That Haas contact is under investigation.
2019-07-14T13:17:02Z: Both the Haas drivers have pitted after making contact at the start of the lap! Grosjean nudged Magnussen off the circuit, and they banged wheels. Not what Haas needed this weekend.
2019-07-14T13:17:00Z: Bottas ends the second lap 0.6s clear of Hamilton, having set the fastest lap so far. DRS is in operation now, though.
2019-07-14T13:16:17Z: Hamilton gets close to Bottas a couple of times, but doesn't really have a chance to overtake. The Mercs have broken clear of soft-shod Leclerc at the start, though.
2019-07-14T13:16:00Z: Hulkenberg's overhauled Albon at the start too, moving up to ninth.
2019-07-14T13:15:26Z: Norris and Ricciardo have a brilliant scrap through Maggotts and Becketts - Norris claims seventh place as a result!
2019-07-14T13:14:15Z: Bottas fend off Hamilton through the first sequence of corners and preserves the lead. No changes in the top order at the start.
2019-07-14T13:13:34Z: Justin Whiting - the son of the late Charlie Whiting - gets the start procedure underway, and the British Grand Prix is go!
2019-07-14T13:11:28Z: Starting tyres:Bottas - mediumHamilton - mediumLeclerc - softVerstappen - mediumGasly - mediumVettel - softRicciardo - softNorris - softAlbon - softHulkenberg - softGiovinazzi - mediumRaikkonen - mediumSainz - mediumGrosjean - softPerez - mediumMagnussen - softKvyat - softStroll - mediumRussell - mediumKubica - medium
2019-07-14T13:10:44Z: The formation lap is now underway here, Bottas and Hamilton lead the field away.
2019-07-14T13:09:39Z: So it's Bottas from Hamilton on the grid today, with last race's battling duo Leclerc and Verstappen on the second row.
2019-07-14T13:07:18Z: Just under five minutes until we get underway here at Silverstone, and like most of the weekend, the conditions are very cool indeed...as in, not massively warm, rather than just being rather good.
2019-07-14T13:02:56Z: Red Bull have got some rear wing issues, and have been making some very last minute changes to Verstappen's car.
2019-07-14T13:02:17Z: Hello and welcome to the Autosport Live coverage of the British Grand Prix! The race will start in just under 10 minutes - and there's already drama on the grid!
